Package renderer

Class Camera

java.lang.Object
renderer.Camera
public class Camera extends Object
class of camera helps construct rays through view plane pixels and find intersections it also implements depth of field and jagged edges improvements from part 8 as well as multi-threading and adaptive super-sampling from part 9

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type
    Field
    Description
    static int
    MAX_RECURSION
    maximum recursion, for button

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    Camera(Point centerCam, Vector vto, Vector vup)
    this constructor receives vup and vto and creates vright, creates an object of class camera

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    Color
    castRay(int j, int i)
    this function casts a ray from the camera through the current pixel and returns the color of that pixel this function is designed to save time when implementing the fix for jagged edges the time improvement here is from 38 seconds to 16 seconds on my computer
    Color
    castRayOld(int j, int i)
    cast ray is the main function in which the modifications of part 8 are made for this reason, there are multiple clauses checking which fix we are currently in this function casts a ray from the camera through the current pixel and returns the color of that pixel this is called "old" because it is called when the adaptive super sampling is not used
    Ray
    constructDepthRay(Point aperturePoint, Point focalPoint)
    this function creates a ray from the aperture point (which changes multiple times in one pixel) the ray goes through the focal point (calculated one time per pixel)

  • Constructor Details

    • Camera

      public Camera(Point centerCam, Vector vto, Vector vup)
      this constructor receives vup and vto and creates vright, creates an object of class camera
      Parameters:
      centerCam - the center point of the camera
      vto - direction the camera is facing
      vup - orientation of the camera

    • setFocalLength

      public Camera setFocalLength(double focalLength)
      set focal length is used as part of the depth of field improvement (part 8) this determines which items in the scene will be in focus
      Parameters:
      focalLength - the distance of the focal plane from the camera
      Returns:
      the camera

    • setApertureSize

      public Camera setApertureSize(double apertureSize)
      aperture size is used as part of the depth of field improvement (part 8) this determines how blurry the items which are not in focus will be
      Parameters:
      apertureSize - a small double indicating how blurry items should be when not in focus
      Returns:
      the camera

    • renderImage

      public Camera renderImage()
      function render Image checks that all the fields are initialized and then renders the image this function uses some of the on/off buttons to determine which functions to call and in what manner
      Returns:
      camera in build like manner

    • printGrid

      public void printGrid(int interval, Color color)
      function printGrid places a grid
      Parameters:
      interval - size of the squares in the grid
      color - color of the grid

    • writeToImage

      public void writeToImage()
      function checks the parameters and then calls function from class ImageWriter to create the image

    • constructRay

      public Ray constructRay(int nX, int nY, int j, int i)
      function creates a ray through the pixel
      Parameters:
      nX - number of columns
      nY - number of rows
      j - current column
      i - current row
      Returns:
      ray through that pixel

    • constructDepthRay

      public Ray constructDepthRay(Point aperturePoint, Point focalPoint)
      this function creates a ray from the aperture point (which changes multiple times in one pixel) the ray goes through the focal point (calculated one time per pixel)
      Parameters:
      aperturePoint - a point near the Camera moved slightly according to the aperture size
      focalPoint - the point of focus directly from the camera through the pixel according to the focal length
      Returns:
      the ray

    • createMiddlePixel

      public Point createMiddlePixel(int nX, int nY, int j, int i)
      this function recieves the parameters of a pixel and returns a point in the middle of the pixel
      Parameters:
      nX - number of columns
      nY - number of rows
      j - current column
      i - current row
      Returns:
      middle of pixel

    • castRayOld

      public Color castRayOld(int j, int i)
      cast ray is the main function in which the modifications of part 8 are made for this reason, there are multiple clauses checking which fix we are currently in this function casts a ray from the camera through the current pixel and returns the color of that pixel this is called "old" because it is called when the adaptive super sampling is not used
      Parameters:
      j - the column of the pixel
      i - the row of the pixel
      Returns:
      color of the pixel

    • castRay

      public Color castRay(int j, int i)
      this function casts a ray from the camera through the current pixel and returns the color of that pixel this function is designed to save time when implementing the fix for jagged edges the time improvement here is from 38 seconds to 16 seconds on my computer
      Parameters:
      j - the column of the pixel
      i - the row of the pixel
      Returns:
      color of the pixel

    • recursivePixelColor

      public Color recursivePixelColor(Point upperCorner, Color upperColor, Point bottomCorner, Color bottomColor, Vector Vup, Vector Vright, String leftRight, int recursionNum, double widthOfPixelSection, double heightOfPixelSection)
      This function is the recursive calculation of a color for a pixel or a section of a pixel.
      Parameters:
      upperCorner - upper left or right corner of pixel section
      upperColor - color of upper corner
      bottomCorner - bottom left or right corner of pixel section
      bottomColor - color of bottom corner
      Vup - vector going up (camera coordinates)
      Vright - vector going right (camera coordinates)
      leftRight - whether upper corner is to the left or the right of the bottom corner
      recursionNum - number of the current recursion
      widthOfPixelSection - the width of the current pixel section
      heightOfPixelSection - the height of the current pixel section
      Returns:
      color of pixel segment( it's the recursive function)

    • setDepthButton

      public void setDepthButton(boolean button, double apertureSize, double focalLength)
      on/off button for depth of field (part 8)
      Parameters:
      button - on/off
      apertureSize - a small number indicating how blurry objects which are not in focus should be
      focalLength - how far away the objects which are in focus are

    • setDepthButton

      public void setDepthButton(boolean depthButton)
      on/off button for depth of field
      Parameters:
      depthButton - on/off

    • setJaggedEdgesButton

      public void setJaggedEdgesButton(boolean jaggedEdgesButton, int numberOfMiniPixels)
      on/off button for jagged edges (part 8)
      Parameters:
      jaggedEdgesButton - on/off
      numberOfMiniPixels - root of how many rays should be created per minipixel

    • setJaggedEdgesButton

      public void setJaggedEdgesButton(boolean jaggedEdgesButton)
      on/off button for jagged edges
      Parameters:
      jaggedEdgesButton - on/off

    • setMultithreading

      public Camera setMultithreading(int i)
      on/off button for multi-threading time improvement (part 9)
      Parameters:
      i - how many threads to have
      Returns:
      the camera

      public Camera setDebugPrint(double v)

      Parameters:
      v - interval of how often to print
      Returns:
      the camera

      Returns:

    • setAdaptiveSuperSampling

      public Camera setAdaptiveSuperSampling(boolean adaptiveSuperSampling, int recursion)
      on/off button for adaptive super sampling (part 9)
      Parameters:
      adaptiveSuperSampling - on/off
      recursion - max amount of recursions
      Returns:
      the camera
